alert.note: Alert for Lower Lafourche; Lower Terrebonne; Upper Lafourche (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 12:29PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Terrebonne, east central Lafourche, central Jefferson and west central Plaquemines Parishes through 115 PM CDT... At 1228 PM CDT, emergency management reported a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout near Cut Off, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts or tropical funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Emergency management reported tropical funnel cloud north of Larose. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Larose, Cut Off, Galliano, Lockport, Golden Meadow, Myrtle Grove, Lafitte, Montegut and Barataria. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near area waterways, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Lower Lafourche; Lower Terrebonne; Upper Lafourche
